title: Heegner number
summary: In number theory, a Heegner number (as termed by Conway and Guy) is a square-free positive integer d such that the imaginary quadratic field Q [ âˆ’ d ] {\displaystyle \mathbb {Q} \left[{\sqrt {-d}}\right]} has class number 1. Equivalently, its ring of integers has unique factorization.[1]
